poem:
"Britain Sleepwalking"

Politicians sketch shadows on our walls,  
Aghast claims in the morning halls.  
Opaque, your 'ghettoised' descries,  
Unseen by my Northern eyes.  

In the gut of our green isle,  
Unity dwells, stands defile.  
Division's spectre, none can hush,  
Yet resilience whispers in the bush.  

Brotherhood, not despair, we seek,  
In each Briton, mild or meek,  
For our chorus remains untamed,  
Even when the world's inflamed.
